      <article class="entry clearfix post-6078 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-theme-releases" id="post-6078">
       <span class="post-meta">
        Dec
        <span>
         11
        </span>
       </span>
       <h1 class="title">
        Divi Is Finally Here, And Its Our Most Powerful, Flexible &amp; Beautiful Theme Yet
       </h1>
       <p class="meta-info">
        Posted  on December 11 by
        <a href="http://www.elegantthemes.com/blog/author/admin" rel="author" title="Posts by Nick Roach">
         Nick Roach
        </a>
        in
        <a href="http://www.elegantthemes.com/blog/category/theme-releases" rel="category tag">
         Theme Releases
        </a>
        |
        <span class="comments-number">
         <a href="http://www.elegantthemes.com/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme#respond">
          957 comments
         </a>
        </span>
       </p>
       <div class="post-thumbnail">
        <img alt="Divi Is Finally Here, And Its Our Most Powerful, Flexible &amp; Beautiful Theme Yet" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/divi-release-thumbnail.jpg"/>
       </div>
       <!-- end .post-thumbnail -->
       <div style="clear: both;">
       </div>
       <p>
        We have been working tirelessly for over three months on Divi, and it feels great to finally release the most powerful theme we have ever created. Divi is the smartest, most flexible theme in our collection. Its advanced page builder and collection of robust modules allow you to create pages from the ground up, giving you complete creative control over your website. Whether you are creating a new online portfolio, an eCommerce storefront, or a new home for your business, Divi ships with everything you need to make your vision a reality.
       </p>
       <p>
        Divi is completely different that any other theme you will find in our collection. With Divi, everything is built using the builder. Each piece of your website is a building block that can be customized and arranged in any number of ways. This method leads to complete control, and truly unique and dynamic pages. Where you have been confined to a single layout structure with our previous themes, Divi breaks down the design into individual elements with unlimited possibilities.
       </p>
       <a href="http://www.elegantthemes.com/preview/Divi/" id="jointoday_button" style="text-decoration: none; margin-left: 140px; margin-right: 30px; margin-top: 30px; font-size: 20px; font-family: Georgia; display: inline-block;" target="_blank">
        <span style=" padding: 7px 20px;">
         Live Demo
        </span>
       </a>
       <a href="http://www.elegantthemes.com/gallery/divi/" id="jointoday_button" style="text-decoration: none; text-shadow: 1px 1px 0px #569b57; font-size: 20px; font-family: Georgia; display: inline-block;" target="_blank">
        <span style=" padding: 7px 20px;">
         Features Info
        </span>
       </a>
       <div class="post-thumbnail" style="margin: 80px 0 0 0;">
        <a href="http://www.elegantthemes.com/preview/Divi">
         <img alt="screenshot" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6146" height="2016" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/screenshot.jpg" width="600"/>
        </a>
       </div>
       <div style="border-bottom: 1px solid #d0d2d2; margin: 100px 0; clear: both; float: left; display: block; width: 600px;">
       </div>
       <h2 style="margin-top: 60px; margin-bottom: 5px;">
        The Advanced Pagebuilder
       </h2>
       <p>
        Divi will change the way you build websites forever. The advanced page builder makes it possible to build truly dynamic pages without learning code.
       </p>
       <img alt="builder" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6082" height="425" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/builder.jpg" style="margin: 20px 0 0 0;" width="600"/>
       <div style="float: left; clear: both; margin-top: 80px">
        <img alt="modules" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6089" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/modules.jpg" style="float: left; margin-right: 60px;"/>
        <div style="float: left; width: 250px;">
         <h2 style="padding-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 5px;">
          Robust Modules
         </h2>
         The builder comes packed with tons of great modules, and more are on the way! Combine and arrange them in any order.
        </div>
       </div>
       <div style="float: left; clear: both; margin-top: 80px">
        <img alt="modules" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6089" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/options.jpg" style="float: left; margin-right: 60px;"/>
        <div style="float: left; width: 250px;">
         <h2 style="padding-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 5px;">
          Countless Options
         </h2>
         With the numerous options that come with each Divi Module,  you can control the appearance and functionality of every element on your website.
        </div>
       </div>
       <div style="float: left; clear: both; margin-top: 80px">
        <img alt="modules" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6089" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/drag-drop.jpg" style="float: left; margin-right: 60px;"/>
        <div style="float: left; width: 250px;">
         <h2 style="padding-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 5px; margin-top: 0px;">
          Drag &amp; Drop
         </h2>
         The Divi Page Builder functions on a drag and drop editing system that allows you to customize and arrange your design with ease.
        </div>
       </div>
       <div style="float: left; clear: both; margin-top: 80px">
        <img alt="modules" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6089" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/video-bgs.jpg" style="float: left; margin-right: 60px;"/>
        <div style="float: left; width: 250px;">
         <h2 style="padding-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 5px;">
          Video Backgrounds
         </h2>
         Let the creativity flow with video backgrounds in your sliders and in any section of your website.
        </div>
       </div>
       <div style="float: left; clear: both; margin-top: 80px">
        <img alt="modules" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6089" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/premade.jpg" style="float: left; margin-right: 60px;"/>
        <div style="float: left; width: 250px;">
         <h2 style="padding-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 5px;">
          Premade Layouts
         </h2>
         Weve included a ton of premade layouts that you can get started with. Just fill the sample layouts with your own content for a quick and amazing looking website.
        </div>
       </div>
       <div style="float: left; clear: both; margin-top: 80px">
        <img alt="modules" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6089" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/savelayouts.jpg" style="float: left; margin-right: 60px;"/>
        <div style="float: left; width: 250px;">
         <h2 style="padding-top: 0px; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 5px;">
          Save &amp; Load Layouts
         </h2>
         Save your favorite layouts for future use throughout your website.
        </div>
       </div>
       <div style="float: left; clear: both; margin-top: 80px">
        <img alt="export_import" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6165" height="201" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/export_import.jpg" style="float: left; margin-right: 60px;" width="280"/>
        <div style="float: left; width: 250px;">
         <h2 style="padding-top: 0px; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 5px;">
          Export &amp; Import Saved Layouts
         </h2>
         You can also export you saved layouts and import them to different WordPress installs.
        </div>
       </div>
       <div style="border-bottom: 1px solid #d0d2d2; margin: 100px 0; clear: both; float: left; display: block; width: 600px;">
       </div>
       <div style="text-align: center;">
        <h2 style="margin-bottom: 0;">
         Theres Something For Everyone
        </h2>
        <p>
         Divi supports eCommerce, Portfolios, Blogs and so much more.
        </p>
       </div>
       <img alt="varieties" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6095" height="425" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/varieties.jpg" width="600"/>
       <div style="text-align: center;">
        <h2 style="margin-top: 120px; margin-bottom: 0;">
         Stunning Portfolios
        </h2>
        <p>
         With Divis portfolio module, you can show off your work anywhere on your site. Choose from our premade portfolio layouts, or create one entirely from scratch!
        </p>
       </div>
       <img alt="portfolios" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6091" height="462" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/portfolios.jpg" width="600"/>
       <div style="text-align: center;">
        <h2 style="margin-top: 120px; margin-bottom: 0;">
         eCommerce Integration
        </h2>
        <p>
         Combined with WooCommerce, Divi has what you need to get an online store up and running in no time. Weve included a couple of premade store layouts, and the store module lets you sell anywhere on your site.
        </p>
       </div>
       <img alt="eCommerce" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6086" height="580" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/eCommerce.jpg" width="600"/>
       <div style="text-align: center;">
        <h2 style="margin-top: 120px; margin-bottom: 0;">
         Gorgeous Blog Layouts
        </h2>
        <p>
         Divi comes with various blog layouts to choose from that you can customize to your every need. Using Divis builder you can place blog posts anywhere within your website.
        </p>
       </div>
       <img alt="blogs" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6081" height="272" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/blogs.jpg" width="600"/>
       <div style="text-align: center;">
        <h2 style="margin-top: 120px; margin-bottom: 0;">
         Business Savvy
        </h2>
        <p>
         Need a professional looking site for your business? Look no further. Divis wide range of business savvy modules lets you easily create serious yet modern looking designs.
        </p>
       </div>
       <img alt="business" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6083" height="440" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/business.jpg" width="600"/>
       <div style="text-align: center;">
        <h2 style="margin-top: 120px; margin-bottom: 0;">
         Fullwidth Beauty
        </h2>
        <p>
         Divis fullwidth section attributes allow to build truly amazing pages. With fullwidth images, videos, color backgrounds, and a little bit of imagination, the possibilities are countless.
        </p>
       </div>
       <img alt="fullwidth" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6087" height="342" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/fullwidth.jpg" width="600"/>
       <div style="text-align: center;">
        <h2 style="margin-top: 120px; margin-bottom: 0;">
         Elegantly Responsive
        </h2>
        <p>
         Divis layout has been designed with mobile devices in mind. No matter how you use it, and no matter how you view it, your website is going to look great.
        </p>
       </div>
       <div style="text-align: center;">
        <img alt="responsive" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6093" height="370" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/responsive.jpg" width="440"/>
       </div>
       <div style="text-align: center;">
        <h2 style="margin-top: 120px; margin-bottom: 0;">
         The Customizer
        </h2>
        <p>
         Divi makes it easy to adjust every aspect of your website. Quickly change your websites colors and choose from dozens of web fonts.
        </p>
       </div>
       <img alt="customizer" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6084" height="310" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/customizer.jpg" width="600"/>
       <div style="text-align: center;">
        <h2 style="margin-top: 120px; margin-bottom: 0;">
         This Is Just The Beginning
        </h2>
        <p>
         Our main focus for the initial release of Divi was create a strong foundation that we could easily expand upon in the future. Our builder has been built to scale, making it easy for us to add more modules in the future.
         <strong>
          The module set you see today is just a glimpse into the future of Divis awesomeness
         </strong>
         <img alt=":)" class="wp-smiley" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-includes/images/smilies/simple-smile.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>
        </p>
       </div>
       <img alt="the_future" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6153" height="445" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/the_future.jpg" width="600"/>
       <div style="border-bottom: 1px solid #d0d2d2; margin: 100px 0; clear: both; float: left; display: block; width: 600px;">
       </div>
       <div style="text-align: center;">
        <h2 style="margin-top: 120px; margin-bottom: 0; font-size: 52px;">
         The 12 Days of Divi
        </h2>
        <p>
         Along with the official launch of Divi, we will be releasing a Divi related blog post for 12 consecutive days. We are kicking it off with the official launch of Divi and a free Lifetime Membership giveaway. The winners will be announced in our 12th Day of Divi post.  Enter today for a chance to win one of 10 free Lifetime Memberships!
        </p>
       </div>
       <img alt="12days" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-6080" height="690" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/12days.jpg" width="600"/>
       <span class="et_social_bottom_trigger">
       </span>
       <div class="post-author">
        <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-48 photo" height="48" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/ad164d20ae5e643564eb3374476aa8a2?s=48&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/ad164d20ae5e643564eb3374476aa8a2?s=96&amp;r=g 2x" width="48"/>
        <div>
         <h3>
          By Nick Roach
         </h3>
         I am the founder and lead designer at Elegant Themes. When I'm not hard at work on new themes, I enjoy writing an article or two on our blog!
        </div>
       </div>
       <a href="http://www.elegantthemes.com/gallery/divi/?utm_source=footer&amp;utm_medium=divi&amp;utm_campaign=blog">
        <img alt="download divi" src="//cdn.elegantthemes.com/images/blog-footer-divi.jpg"/>
       </a>
      </article>
      <!-- You can start editing here. -->

           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/f252c037c059b2a48a895f4d54d1a469?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/f252c037c059b2a48a895f4d54d1a469?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>
          <!-- end .avatar-box -->
          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            <a class="url" href="http://www.heraclesflint.com" rel="external nofollow">
             Nick Moore
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            December 11, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            Elegant Themes provided me with the tools (Foxy) to produce a great website that helped promote my book to a successful run on Kickstarter a few months ago. I have waited for Divi, stunned by the teasers, and gleefully collected the generous freebies the ET team has produced to tide us over until todays release. With Divi you have really knocked it out of the park ladies and gents, and its currently uploading to my server for me to dive into later.
           </p>
           <p>
            Ive a huge new website coming to promote the book and Divi gives me every tool I could possibly need, and Ill be happily promoting ET on that site when it launches. Great themes, at a great price, with great support. I hope that the negative comments that some ungrateful idiots had previously been posting were ignored for the hot air they were.
           </p>
           <p>
            Another great release, dammit it, it might be the best release ever from ET, congratulations to all
            <img alt=":-)" class="wp-smiley" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-includes/images/smilies/simple-smile.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Nick Moore" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=105557#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-105557", "105557", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
          <!-- end comment-content-->
         </article>

           <p>
            Oh, this looks really amazing. This will without doubt be my new go-to-theme for every new project. Move over Canvas/Woothemes.
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Frode Lamy" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=105571#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-105571", "105571", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
          <!-- end comment-content-->
         </article>
         <!-- end comment-body -->

                <a aria-label="Reply to Kenny" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=106321#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-106321", "106321", "respond", "6078" )'>
                 Reply
                </a>
               </div>
              </div>
              <!-- end comment-content-->
             </article>
             <!-- end comment-body -->
            </li>

            <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
            <div class="comment-content clearfix">
             <p>
              Actually the slides will render correctly  we just forget to setup the module with a background image! I have updated the demo, so you can re-load the page to test it out. On smartphones, a background image is used instead of a video.
             </p>
             <p>
              As for swiping, this is something we will be adding in the future. For now, you can use the circle navigation at the bottom of the slide.
             </p>
             <div class="reply-container">

                Hi Nick, I really love the Divi theme its great in so many ways! One problem Ive encountered though is that the slider wont show a read more button when rendered in portrait mode on an iPhone for example. You only get the headline and as such you cant get into the slide show articles.
               </p>

Thanks for all your hard workit will truly pay off for you.  Best wishes for a very prosperous New Year!

          <!-- #comment-## -->
          <li class="comment even depth-2" id="li-comment-140485">
           <article class="comment-body" id="comment-140485">
            <div class="avatar-box">
             <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6efffd6252d49f9d86015fe5a6c8443d?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6efffd6252d49f9d86015fe5a6c8443d?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
            </div>
            <!-- end .avatar-box -->
            <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
             <span class="fn">
              <a class="url" href="http://clearwhitedental.com" rel="external nofollow">
               Brad
              </a>
             </span>
             <span class="comment_date">
              April 27, 2014
             </span>
            </div>
            <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
            <div class="comment-content clearfix">
             <p>
              SOLUTION.  Heres what I did:  In your photo editor (Photoshop, in my case), simply take your image for your logo, anchor the image on the left, resize the canvas to stretch out enough width to add an address, keeping it at the same height.  Youll have a long, skinny image canvas.  Then you can put your address information in there to the right of the logo.  You can make your address and phone information in whatever color and font you like.  Save the image and upload it as your logo on the General Settings page.
             </p>
             <p>
              If you use the Fixed Navigation Bar (in General Settings in Divi Theme Options), the address information will shrink just as the logo does.  You can either choose not to use a fixed navigation bar; or else, when making the logo/address image, make your font large enough to where you dont mind it shrinking as the page is scrolled.
             </p>
             <p>
              Very nice and beautiful theme, Nick.  I agree with whoever said modules may be the future, not themes.  Divi is quite an innovation.
             </p>
             <div class="reply-container">
              <a aria-label="Reply to Brad" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=140485#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-140485", "140485", "respond", "6078" )'>
               Reply
              </a>
             </div>
            </div>
            <!-- end comment-content-->
           </article>
           <!-- end comment-body -->
           <ul class="children">
            <li class="comment odd alt depth-3" id="li-comment-141856">
             <article class="comment-body" id="comment-141856">
              <div class="avatar-box">
               <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/adc2f98bb669e1971a7276031d9156e9?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/adc2f98bb669e1971a7276031d9156e9?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
              </div>
              <!-- end .avatar-box -->
              <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
               <span class="fn">
                <a class="url" href="http://clearwhitedental.com" rel="external nofollow">
                 brad
                </a>
               </span>
               <span class="comment_date">
                May 18, 2014
               </span>
              </div>
              <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
              <div class="comment-content clearfix">
               <p>
                An addendum to my advice above:  I discovered my solution works for the desktop version, but makes the logo and contact information almost unreadable in mobile mode.  I have the same need to have the address / phone number in the header, so I will continue trying some other solutions.  In the meantime, Ill keep it looking nice for the desktop version.  Pretty much any small business needs their contact information at the top of the page, so it would be nice to have an easy solution built into the theme, one that wouldnt take too much vertical space in the header.
               </p>
               <div class="reply-container">
                <a aria-label="Reply to brad" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=141856#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-141856", "141856", "respond", "6078" )'>
                 Reply
                </a>
               </div>
              </div>
              <!-- end comment-content-->
             </article>
             <!-- end comment-body -->
            </li>
            <!-- #comment-## -->
            <li class="comment even depth-3" id="li-comment-141864">
             <article class="comment-body" id="comment-141864">
              <div class="avatar-box">
               <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/adc2f98bb669e1971a7276031d9156e9?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/adc2f98bb669e1971a7276031d9156e9?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
              </div>
              <!-- end .avatar-box -->
              <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
               <span class="fn">
                <a class="url" href="http://clearwhitedental.com" rel="external nofollow">
                 Brad
                </a>
               </span>
               <span class="comment_date">
                May 18, 2014
               </span>
              </div>
              <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
              <div class="comment-content clearfix">
               <p>
                Okay, real solution for getting your address (or any other text) in the header this time, and no shrinking your logo illegibly in the mobile version. This solution is probably nothing to you guys who do this for a living, but this isnt my day job.
               </p>
               <p>
                First create your child theme.  If you dont know what Im talking about, do a search.  Check out the WP codex, or the ET guys have a post on it.
               </p>
               <p>
                Next, copy the header.php from the Divi theme folder into the Divi-child theme folder you created.  So you should have two files in your Divi-child folder:  style.css and header.php.
               </p>
               <p>
                Edit style.css in the child folder to include this code:
               </p>
               <p>
                #myheadertext { float: left; -moz-transition: all 0.2s ease-in-out; -webkit-transition: all 0.2s ease-in-out; transition: all 0.2s ease-in-out; margin-bottom: 18px; margin-top:5px;}
               </p>
               <p>
                You plop it down right below the line that says Theme customization starts here.  You may have to adjust that margin-top to whatever works for you.  I had two address lines using H6 (header 6 text), and this worked for me.
               </p>
               <p>
                Next, edit the header.php.  This is where youll put your address and phone number information.  The code for my address looked something like this:
               </p>
               <p>
                My Name  |  555-867-53091234 Main St.  |  Any City, Florida  54321
               </p>
               <p>
                Where do you put it?  For me it worked to put it right after the first .  So do a search for  in header.php, and drop it right in there.
               </p>
               <p>
                Hope this works for anyone else who needs contact information in the header.  And perhaps you ET guys can help us by including this in the General Settings in future updates.  Thanks, I still love the theme!
               </p>
               <div class="reply-container">
                <a aria-label="Reply to Brad" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=141864#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-141864", "141864", "respond", "6078" )'>
                 Reply
                </a>
               </div>
              </div>
              <!-- end comment-content-->
             </article>
             <!-- end comment-body -->
             <ul class="children">

        <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-105689">
         <article class="comment-body" id="comment-105689">
          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/c9b62a2f56a29af979fd20e952bad5e0?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/c9b62a2f56a29af979fd20e952bad5e0?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>

          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            <a class="url" href="http://sevillaprofesional.com" rel="external nofollow">
             Antonio Castro
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            December 11, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            About new modules ideas:
           </p>
           <p>
            1. Id love to have the chance to change backgrounds for each row.
           </p>
           <p>
            2. Id to have a module for third parties shortcodes integration.
           </p>
           <p>
            3. Id like to see an API where third parties can add their own modules or plugins integrations. For example, Id love to use layered sliders like Slider Revolution or Smart Slider plugins.
           </p>
           <p>
            Thanks!!!
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">

        <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-105711">
         <article class="comment-body" id="comment-105711">
          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/3990de14c790670ffe0c2c7bae195054?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/3990de14c790670ffe0c2c7bae195054?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>
          <!-- end .avatar-box -->
          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            Samuel McEdwards
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            December 11, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            Great! I think I now have reason to keep my membership!
            <img alt=":)" class="wp-smiley" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-includes/images/smilies/simple-smile.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            Less than a month ago, I signed up for the Developers Membership. I was excited, even though I had few issues with some elements of the themes. Eg. Technically all themes headers are the same, and some full width layout issues. I signup anyway because, I thought, I could use my css, html5, php and other web design skills to customize the themes.
           </p>
           <p>
            Unfortunately, every theme I tried didnt give me the desired result due to the limitations placed on them. I ended up going back to a non elegant theme which gave me the result I wanted.
           </p>
           <p>
            I was considering to cancel my membership and ask for a refund. I never knew about the coming of DIV, so I wasnt expecting any thing to keep me waiting or staying.
           </p>
           <p>
            With this release of DIV and the features description I see, it looks very promising. So, Im going to keep my membership and will try DIV today. Ive downloaded the theme from my membership area and will give it a test ride.
           </p>
           <p>
            Thanks for the hard work.
           </p>
           <p>
            Hope this is indeed Our Most Powerful, Flexible &amp; Beautiful Theme Yet!
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Samuel McEdwards" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=105711#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-105711", "105711", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>

             <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/ad164d20ae5e643564eb3374476aa8a2?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/ad164d20ae5e643564eb3374476aa8a2?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>

             <p>
              Thanks for the suggestion. Revolution slider is not something we could include in our themes due to licensing incompatibilities. However, we could potentially add support for those who have purchased it.
             </p>

               <span class="fn">

               </span>
               <span class="comment_date">

               </span>
              </div>
              <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
              <div class="comment-content clearfix">
               <p>
                I second (or is it third or fifth now  the request to add support for Revolution Slider to the theme.  I understand the licensing incompatibilities. But for those who have indeed purchased Revolution Slider and would love to see its shortcodes supported in place of the built in slider it would absolutely kick Divi to the next level.  I can envision Divi detecting it Revolution Slider is installed and if so have a spot in the full width slider area for the shortcode to be entered.  Dare to dream
               </p>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-admin bypostauthor odd alt depth-2" id="li-comment-106102">
           <article class="comment-body" id="comment-106102">
            <div class="avatar-box">
             <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/ad164d20ae5e643564eb3374476aa8a2?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/ad164d20ae5e643564eb3374476aa8a2?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
            </div>
            <!-- end .avatar-box -->
            <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
             <span class="fn">
              Nick
             </span>
             <span class="comment_date">
              December 12, 2013
             </span>
            </div>
            <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
            <div class="comment-content clearfix">
             <p>
              Right now videos do not work on mobile devices. We display the sliders BG image instead. The reason for this is because iPhones do not play the video automatically, but instead open the player in a new window, which is a bad experience for your visitors.
             </p>
             <div class="reply-container">
              <a aria-label="Reply to Nick" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=106102#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-106102", "106102", "respond", "6078" )'>
               Reply
              </a>
             </div>
            </div>

           <p>
            Impressed and I mean IMPRESSED in capital letters. I was checking out all the possibilities you mention above and played around with the demo site. This is indeed a whole new ball game which makes your clients getting more value then they actually pay for your themes. Totally awesome. Really looking forward to see this in real action soon on one of my own websites. Really appreciate all the hard work that has been going into this theme, because that is very clear: some people worked really hard to create this piece of awesomeness. Thanks to you all for giving us such a great new tool.
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Jacobus" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=105728#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-105728", "105728", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
          <!-- end comment-content-->
         </article>
         <!-- end comment-body -->

            This Theme is awesome!            </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to John Palacios" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=105743#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-105743", "105743", "respond", "6078" )'>

         </article>

             <article class="comment-body" id="comment-106925">
              <div class="avatar-box">
               <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/bc6fcdc258d61c6fa42a0eac045f1a50?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/bc6fcdc258d61c6fa42a0eac045f1a50?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
              </div>
              <!-- end .avatar-box -->
              <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
               <span class="fn">
                Ben Wolfe
               </span>
               <span class="comment_date">
                December 18, 2013
               </span>
              </div>
              <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
              <div class="comment-content clearfix">
               <p>
                YES to this. So much of Divi is a leap into another level for your themes. An AJAX portfolio with filtering, using something like Isotope, is a natural and necessary part of that evolution. Im very, very impressed with Divi, in both design and function. Full marks, SO well done even in version 1. And yet that one issue may be enough for me to look elsewhere
               </p>
               <p>
                Other wishes: it would be great to be able to change some basic styling, like margins and padding, to modules from right inside them, without custom CSS.
               </p>
               <p>
                (Dont take this as much of a criticism when youve just pitched a winning game in the big leagues  but I also hope your Theme Options panel is due for an update soon. Its looking awfully old, confusing and clunky now.)
               </p>
               <div class="reply-container">
                <a aria-label="Reply to Ben Wolfe" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=106925#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-106925", "106925", "respond", "6078" )'>

           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Timothy W Pawiro" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=105757#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-105757", "105757", "respond", "6078" )'>

         <ul class="children">
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-admin bypostauthor even depth-2" id="li-comment-105758">
           <article class="comment-body" id="comment-105758">
            <div class="avatar-box">
             <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/ad164d20ae5e643564eb3374476aa8a2?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/ad164d20ae5e643564eb3374476aa8a2?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
            </div>
            <!-- end .avatar-box -->
            <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
             <span class="fn">
              Nick
             </span>
             <span class="comment_date">
              December 11, 2013
             </span>
            </div>
            <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
            <div class="comment-content clearfix">
             <p>
              That depends on the size of your video. The higher the quality and the longer the video, the higher the file size will be. The higher the file size of your page, the longer it will take to load.
             </p>
             <div class="reply-container">
              <a aria-label="Reply to Nick" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=105758#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-105758", "105758", "respond", "6078" )'>

             </span>
            </div>
            <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
            <div class="comment-content clearfix">
             <p>
              Thanks Bobshoe, its already great to hear success stories from our customers. For a membership site, using a third party plugin would be ideal, as that probably isnt what a theme should be dealing with. You want to keep your members separate from the theme in case you ever need to change themes. For paid memberships, I think WooCommerce would be able to handle it.
             </p>
             <div class="reply-container">

        <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-105823">
         <article class="comment-body" id="comment-105823">
          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/f6b2eefa6376204dc69d9001167f60ca?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/f6b2eefa6376204dc69d9001167f60ca?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>
          <!-- end .avatar-box -->
          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            <a class="url" href="http://www.seojus.com" rel="external nofollow">
             Justin
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            December 11, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            Once again ET does it big. Go big or go home as they say! This was probably the best move to make going forward for continued success of ET.
           </p>
           <p>
            This theme has everything you would possibly need to build a site. I have used almost every theme of ETs and this DIVI them by far is the best.
           </p>
           <p>
            Wish List:
           </p>
           <p>
            1) Built in Icon Fonts (to use for blurbs and anything else)
           </p>
           <p>
            2) Epanel option for entering in a phone number; either under the logo, next to the logo, or opposite side of the page to the logo. Not everyone has a blog, and many businesss need their phone number on their site on the top of the page, and most are not code savy enough to edit the home.php or header.php file, and then style it with CSS.
           </p>
           <p>
            3) Option to use other animations like here 
            <br/>
            <a href="http://themes.themewaves.com/medusa/features/animation/" rel="nofollow">
             http://themes.themewaves.com/medusa/features/animation/
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            4) Music player, mp3 player, ability to add playlists
           </p>
           <p>
            Nick, great job, much appreciated, and keep up the good work
           </p>
           <p>
            Justin
            <br/>
            SEOjus
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Justin" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=105823#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-105823", "105823", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>

         <ul class="children">
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-admin bypostauthor odd alt depth-2" id="li-comment-106125">
           <article class="comment-body" id="comment-106125">
            <div class="avatar-box">
             <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/ad164d20ae5e643564eb3374476aa8a2?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/ad164d20ae5e643564eb3374476aa8a2?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
            </div>
            <!-- end .avatar-box -->
            <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
             <span class="fn">
              Nick
             </span>
             <span class="comment_date">
              December 12, 2013
             </span>
            </div>
            <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
            <div class="comment-content clearfix">
             <p>
              Thanks Justin, these are all things that I see Divi supporting in the future. Built in icon fonts for Blurbs is on our to-do-list. We also hope to introduce various heading formats, one of which would certainly include the option for a phone number. Music plays, as well as audio post formats, in on our list as well
              <img alt=":)" class="wp-smiley" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-includes/images/smilies/simple-smile.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>
             </p>
             <div class="reply-container">

           <p>
            Parse error: syntax error, unexpected T_STRING in /data/41/2/46/33/2046033/user/2241270/htdocs/blog/wp-content/themes/Divi/Divi/et-pagebuilder/et-pagebuilder.php on line 391
           </p>
           <p>
            What is causing this?
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Ben Wilson" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=105844#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-105844", "105844", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
          <!-- end comment-content-->
         </article>
         <!-- end comment-body -->

           <span class="comment_date">
            December 12, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            Very nice work. Divi is a beautiful piece of work and Im excited that its built in such a way as to make improvements easy.
           </p>
           <p>
            Couple of questions
           </p>
           <p>
            How do you install this as a child theme, so that upgrades are simple and dont wipe out code hacks, etc?
           </p>
           <p>
            I see a number of little animations in Divi, but I dont see where these are offered as features. Are these your own little hacks or are they available within the theme?
           </p>
           <p>
            Thanks.
           </p>
           <p>
            Jerry
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Jerry Roberts" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=105961#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-105961", "105961", "respond", "6078" )'>

        <!-- #comment-## -->
        <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-105994">
         <article class="comment-body" id="comment-105994">
          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/2191b1707ecb93dba04fc72ca7eae563?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/2191b1707ecb93dba04fc72ca7eae563?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>
          <!-- end .avatar-box -->
          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            Kaethen
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            December 12, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            You really made me very excited for this theme and now I am a little bit underwhelmed. The available features are almost the same, if not less than the ones from the Goodwork Theme by Ruben Bristian. His theme is more expensive than your membership, so I guess i shouldnt complain. Also you are saying this is just the beginning, and I guess it is a good foundation. So what I will try to do is give some constructive critisism:
            <br/>
            The main thing I am missing is an improved Admin Options Panel. I was very dissapointed to see your usual ePanel again. It has become a bit outdated and offers few options. I dont understand why you still use it to define the Navigation Items. The native WordPress Menus are far better. Also I would have liked to see options that would let the user make changes to the blog layout, like change the size of the Blog Thumbnails (I dont like the huge thumbnails at all), change the excerpt length, etc. without having to change this in the code. It would also be very nice to let the user choose which category uses which kind of blog layout and things like that. This would have been a feature I havent seen anywhere else.
            <br/>
            The Modules are all quite nice, but I havent found anything unespected or innovative.
            <br/>
            I am also a little bit disapointed by with the basic widgets, like the recent posts widget or the search widget the styling isnt just simple its basic and laking attention to detail.
            <br/>
            I like to modify my layouts quite a bit, but this layout is too restrictive for me to make the simple changes I would like without having to spend ages to figure out the code. But it doesnt offer enough options for me to use it without having to make changes to the code.
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Kaethen" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=105994#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-105994", "105994", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
          <!-- end comment-content-->
         </article>
         <!-- end comment-body -->
        </li>

           <p>

           </p>
           <p>
            Example: What hooks or functions can we call?
           </p>
           <p>
            Also how is the performance? Im worried with such a builder that it would slow it down , would it not require more renduring from the theme?
           </p>
           <p>
            Great work on the theme
            <br/>
            Dave.
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Dave Z" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=106000#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-106000", "106000", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
          <!-- end comment-content-->
         </article>
         <!-- end comment-body -->
        </li>

         <article class="comment-body" id="comment-106022">
          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/4c7768c422ce47b1c87eef6f0b5d7620?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/4c7768c422ce47b1c87eef6f0b5d7620?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>
          <!-- end .avatar-box -->
          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            Timur
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            December 12, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            Hi Nick &amp; The Team!
            <img alt=":)" class="wp-smiley" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-includes/images/smilies/simple-smile.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            First of all, thank you for creating the one and only MASTERPIECE that already makes a history right before our eyes!
           </p>
           <p>
            It was definitely worth the wait and couldnt come in a more appropriate time than now. Its going to be my best Christmas ever!
            <img alt=":)" class="wp-smiley" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-includes/images/smilies/simple-smile.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            I have spent more than an hour reading all of the comments above and so many great suggestions have been offered. I can only add a couple of my own to that long list:
           </p>
           <p>
            1. I would love to see a custom video slider module with playlist, so the videos from Youtube, Vimeo and Wistia can be integrated into it.
           </p>
           <p>
            2. A Landing Page layout would make it completely versatile as its so difficult to find beautiful landing page layouts on the market, not mentioning being integrated into the website itself.
           </p>
           <p>
            Apart of that, the Divi is the game-changer in so many ways. Its even easily beats PageLines DMS system. And its all in one magnificent Elegant Theme!
            <img alt=":)" class="wp-smiley" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-includes/images/smilies/simple-smile.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            Thanks you guys for making it happened in such a unique way!
            <br/>
            Greetings from London and Merry Christmas to you all! 
           </p>
           <p>
            Timur
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">

           </p>

           </p>

        <li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-106079">
         <article class="comment-body" id="comment-106079">
          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/acddc82e8aeddee1d31099dcba214c8c?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/acddc82e8aeddee1d31099dcba214c8c?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>
          <!-- end .avatar-box -->
          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            Bay Area Marketing &amp; Media
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            December 12, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            Hi Nick and Elegant Themes
            <br/>
            I spent all night working on our first DIVI website.
            <br/>
            Im loving the new way of design.
           </p>
           <p>
            Dont forget to tell people about these great features:
            <br/>
            1. Create a layout and SAVE it for reuse!
            <br/>
            2. Export a layout to use in other DIVI websites. (GENIUS)
            <br/>
            3. Adding Widget areas in the layout AND adding additional named widgets, right in the widget area!
           </p>
           <p>
            Great Job Guys!
           </p>
           <p>
            Thank You !
           </p>
           <p>
            P.S. Id love to see additional slider functionality, along with more control of slider height, positioning of images, adjustments for image alignment in the image module. Also, a way to adjust margins between modules, rows, and sections.
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Bay Area Marketing &amp; Media" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=106079#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-106079", "106079", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>

          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/7ace002b1f53355f1937716f1b401b28?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/7ace002b1f53355f1937716f1b401b28?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>

           <span class="fn">

           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            This theme rocks! Very good looking and super versatile!
            <br/>
            Looks very complete, but maybe it would be more perfect if there were:
            <br/>
             more header options
            <br/>
             and more options in the e-panel. I think with this theme e-panel could have a little update with more options to complement this theme.
           </p>
           <p>
            There is only one thing I have left to say is: THANKS!
            <br/>
            Wonderful Christmas Present!  Merry Christmas!
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Don" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=106104#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-106104", "106104", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
          <!-- end comment-content-->
         </article>

             <span class="fn">
              Nick
             </span>
             <span class="comment_date">

             </span>

            <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
            <div class="comment-content clearfix">
             <p>
              Thanks for the suggestions Don. We plan to add more header options in the future.
             </p>
             <p>
              As for ePanel, we tried to strip away as many options as possible. Most of the options for the theme are now within the individual modules themselves, which accounts for Divis flexibility.
             </p>
             <div class="reply-container">

              <div class="avatar-box">
               <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/0cd2b21b9dbb2a2037a762445cfb2411?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/0cd2b21b9dbb2a2037a762445cfb2411?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>

               </span>

              <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
              <div class="comment-content clearfix">
               <p>

               </p>

            Well thats a hell of a good theme. Great design really! Ive been wanting to work with one of your goodies for some time. And your final statement about expanding the theme in the future does it for me
            <img alt=":)" class="wp-smiley" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-includes/images/smilies/simple-smile.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>

           </p>
           <p>
             Retina support (at least for the logo which is pixelated on iOS)
            <br/>
             Post types to enable video as a featured image
            <br/>
             Portfolio item with a simple slider in case you have more than one image to show
            <br/>
             Responsive fullscreen (not just full-width) slider with video background for the home page.
           </p>
           <p>
            Keep up the good work!

              <div class="avatar-box">
               <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ea9e4c15a5b87685e79391c74c133f71?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ea9e4c15a5b87685e79391c74c133f71?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
              </div>
              <!-- end .avatar-box -->
              <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
               <span class="fn">
                Jamie
               </span>
               <span class="comment_date">
                December 18, 2013
               </span>
              </div>
              <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
              <div class="comment-content clearfix">
               <p>
                Thanks  that answered my earlier question.  I look forward to the update.  I hope it has a way to tell it to only do a certain number of loops, as sometimes sliders get crazy.
               </p>
               <p>
                I am also mildly concerned with not being able to change the slider height. Those can often overpower some important things just below them.  I could see some cool effects with a slider the same width but just shorter height, so the next tier of homepage items shows clearly too.
               </p>
               <p>
                Thanks to the dev team!
               </p>
               <div class="reply-container">

        <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-106242">
         <article class="comment-body" id="comment-106242">
          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/51e25acd97d84c7094dbb49686a33b9f?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/51e25acd97d84c7094dbb49686a33b9f?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>
          <!-- end .avatar-box -->
          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            <a class="url" href="http://www.kelownatechsupport.com/" rel="external nofollow">
             Ed Rands
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            December 13, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            Liking what I see so far. I have two suggestions.
           </p>
           <p>
            Add a module for embedding an interactive Google map. Good for contact pages of local brick and mortar businesses.
           </p>
           <p>
            Its not a module, but Id love to see a theme that supports vertical side menu navigation instead of the typical horizontal, and still look good on mobile. My last client was adamant about having their menu beside their content, under a giant banner image. I couldnt use any of your themes for that. Ended up using the Gantry Framework, and a rather tacky hack job involving three menus and hiding/showing them based on screen size. If I could just click a setting in Divis options and viola, I have side navigation, Id be in love.. in case another client asks again.
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Ed Rands" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=106242#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-106242", "106242", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>

            Divi is a great theme! Flexible and friendly! Im already using and its really a wonderful and very versatile template. Perhaps the only thing I think could be added is a module to allow for flexibility in the layout of the menu, but I really think that Divi is already really flexible. I hope you understand this translation I did of my original post in Spanish. Greetings!

              Hi Jerry,
             </p>
             <p>
              I saw Nick answer this on another blog post. Those are animated GIFs youre referring to. The ET team created the GIFs themselves. Theres quite a few software apps that let you create GIFs like that: Photoshop, After Effects, Fireworks; to name a few.
             </p>

        <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-106456">
         <article class="comment-body" id="comment-106456">
          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/e73040c9b5a4169f85b4332aacb1bd78?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/e73040c9b5a4169f85b4332aacb1bd78?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>
          <!-- end .avatar-box -->
          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            <a class="url" href="http://www.weddingintuscany.info" rel="external nofollow">
             Francesca
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            December 14, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            I found something very bad in my opinion:
            <br/>
            When I use the builder there are two missing features which are very important:
            <br/>
            1) you cannot change the column type once you have created a section
            <br/>
            2) You cannot have a section with split columns inside. Let me explain: I need a 1/4  1/4  1/2
            <br/>
            but after every 1/4 -1/4 I need to insert a 1/2 divider below. this is impossible to be done
            <br/>
            With the elegant builder plugin this is doable simply adding the possibility to drag COLUMNS TYPES together with the modules..
            <br/>
            3) Also I tried the slider.. I have no clue how to resize max height of the slider.. which is way too big. I tried playing a bit with element min-height values in the CSS but no luck (I also tried removing that and using  a max height value instead.. it only applies to the text area in the slider..
            <img alt=":(" class="wp-smiley" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-includes/images/smilies/frownie.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Francesca" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=106456#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-106456", "106456", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>

           <p>
            Great new theme, looking forward to exploring it.
           </p>
           <p>
            Like a few others have mentioned, an events module would be a great addition. Most of the sites I build at the moment need event management. Each one I do needs a different setup so something flexible to allow: calendar and/or event list views + custom fields for each event + optional event bookings + optional event booking payments. Either all as one module or related modules that work together.
           </p>

             </span>

            <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
            <div class="comment-content clearfix">
             <p>
              The Page Builder is only meant for building pages. Using the builder on posts is not feasible due to how blog posts are typically structured with fixed widths and sidebars.
             </p>
             <div class="reply-container">
              <a aria-label="Reply to Nick" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=106716#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-106716", "106716", "respond", "6078" )'>

        <li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-106802">
         <article class="comment-body" id="comment-106802">
          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/a2cf4f8238f51981957023ad175da8ca?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/a2cf4f8238f51981957023ad175da8ca?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>
          <!-- end .avatar-box -->
          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            John Kirkpatrick
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            December 17, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            Please, please, please tell me you have sometihng in the pipeline to sort out the main logo/nav bar.
           </p>
           <p>
            Without loads of time and coding, websites look the same with the header, which defeats the purpose of the Page Builder etc.
           </p>
           <p>
            Dont get me wrong, the Page Builder is fantastic. But the most important aspect, the nav header is going to be the same as everyone else who uses Divi and this defeats the purpose of its greatness
            <img alt=":)" class="wp-smiley" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-includes/images/smilies/simple-smile.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            I know its not straightforward, but please make this a priority!
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to John Kirkpatrick" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=106802#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-106802", "106802", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
          <!-- end comment-content-->
         </article>
         <!-- end comment-body -->
        </li>
        <!-- #comment-## -->

           </p>
           <p>
            Is there any way in the module builder, or perhaps in a later version, to see what is in a given module?            </p>

           </p>

        <li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-106948">
         <article class="comment-body" id="comment-106948">
          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/cb05dc6e6ea87747d665e68f7ac2e716?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/cb05dc6e6ea87747d665e68f7ac2e716?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>
          <!-- end .avatar-box -->
          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            Charlene
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            December 18, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            Beautiful theme.  As a designer I appreciate starting with a theme that looks great from the get go AND has a lot of flexibility built in.  My only request as you move forward would be to make it easy for me to make additional customizations, because, well thats what I do.  Each client has individual needs and I try my best to provide them a custom solution tailored just for them.   So no matter how great Divi is out of the box I still want as much control as possible.  If it were possible to have a choice to adjust seemingly similar elements styles either as a group OR individually that would be WordPress nirvana for me.
           </p>
           <p>
            As for a requested module moving forward?  An elegant contact us / call to action box that opens up in front of the site in a cool html5 Divi sort of way.  It would have multiple options for filling in either multiple phone numbers, address, contact us form, google map, social networking icons, subscribe to newsletter or ALL of the above.  Oh and as long as Im making my Christmas list, the option to make it a tasteful popup window or a sidebar widget.  If there is an existing plugin for this then combine that with a Divi ready-made solution that looks as awesome as Divi does.
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Charlene" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=106948#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-106948", "106948", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
          <!-- end comment-content-->
         </article>
         <!-- end comment-body -->

          <li class="comment even depth-2" id="li-comment-106949">

            </div>
            <!-- end .avatar-box -->
            <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
             <span class="fn">
              Charlene
             </span>
             <span class="comment_date">
              December 18, 2013
             </span>
            </div>
            <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
            <div class="comment-content clearfix">
             <p>
              Oh, and one more thing, the addition of a content box where I can add text, video, images.  The ability to select the order of all the above info, and whether to use them or not.  Thats all.
              <img alt=":)" class="wp-smiley" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-includes/images/smilies/simple-smile.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>

          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            A very useful framework, congrats! My suggestions are the following. It will be fantastic if the PageBuider were available also for posts.
            <br/>
            Then, I think that you could create a community section on your forum were foreign customers can translate your themes and upload the language files, so the work is done one time for all. It is annoying for we foreign to download a theme and translate it every time, when probably other dozens of people already have done it. You could give a little discount to the most active translators ;).
            <br/>
            Ps hey for this tip I also deserve a discount, or better maybe a lifetime membership
            <img alt=":)" class="wp-smiley" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-includes/images/smilies/simple-smile.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>
            <br/>
            Cheers.
           </p>

        <li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-107302">
         <article class="comment-body" id="comment-107302">
          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/738b0e3ed4c5d7d4bb01ee646a4c4b38?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/738b0e3ed4c5d7d4bb01ee646a4c4b38?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>
          <!-- end .avatar-box -->
          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            <a class="url" href="http://strategicmovesconsulting.com" rel="external nofollow">
             Vernessa Taylor
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            December 20, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            Hi Team, the accolades are well-deserved. Appreciate your hard work.
           </p>
           <p>
            One request: Please make it clearer how Divi handles new vs. pre-existing content.  Your ReadMe documentation indicates:
           </p>
           <blockquote>
            <p>
             If you Switch back to using the default page editor you will will be warned that all of the content you built with the builder will be lost and your previous contents made with the default editor will be restored.
            </p>
           </blockquote>
           <p>
            I was ready to try Divi on an existing site but this warning (which is at the very bottom of the documentation) stopped me just in time.
           </p>
           <p>
            So  can you build in some way for content that is created using Divi to NOT be lost if you decide to switch back to using the default page (or post) editor?
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Vernessa Taylor" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=107302#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-107302", "107302", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
          <!-- end comment-content-->
         </article>

        <li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-107686">
         <article class="comment-body" id="comment-107686">
          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/00309c8be466cdfec5b15b14a0dd066b?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/00309c8be466cdfec5b15b14a0dd066b?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>
          <!-- end .avatar-box -->
          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            massimo
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            December 22, 2013
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            Another request: elements animations are cool on a desktop, but they simply do not work on smartphones and tablets. Try to look at the Divi preview with an iPad, scroll down a little bit faster and you will see a lot of empty spaces, you have to stand still until animations start.
            <br/>
            Safari stop render the pages while it scrolls.
           </p>
           <p>
            To be really responsive (as Divi claim to be) you should definitely get rid of animations on mobile devices.
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to massimo" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=107686#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-107686", "107686", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
          <!-- end comment-content-->
         </article>
         <!-- end comment-body -->

           <p>
            Without a doubt, Divi is one of greatest theme on the earth. But however, creativity will restrict people to maximize the power of Divi. And unfortunately, no all people have good creativity. So, I think it will be better if Divi is completed and added with a lot of built in pre made layout and pre made generic content. It will help ordinary people like me to play and explore more the power of Divi.
           </p>

            What I find reeeeeeally incredible is the price-feature ratio, one must be a dummy to not try this out. My wish for you is that you will stand out on the market also in future with amazing products and crazy low price!
            <br/>
            A super feature for a future could be some advanced marketing feature, like time-delayed display of the pricing column. My vote also for Easy Digital Downloads integration.
            <br/>
            You did a great and elegant job with Divi, compliments!
            <img alt=":-)" class="wp-smiley" src="http://cdn.elegantthemes.com/blog/wp-includes/images/smilies/simple-smile.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>
           </p>

          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            No doubt it is a great theme. Elegant Themes have always been the people I go to first for a new site theme.
           </p>
           <p>
            However, its frighteningly close to the theme Salient (
            <a href="http://themeforest.net/item/salient-responsive-multipurpose-theme/full_screen_preview/4363266" rel="nofollow">
             http://themeforest.net/item/salient-responsive-multipurpose-theme/full_screen_preview/4363266
            </a>
            ). I know that these days there are so many themes that they are bound to look alike sometimes  but this seems to do everything Salient does but in a slightly differently cosmetic way.
           </p>
           <p>
            Im still working out if this is good or bad. Salient has been such a brilliant theme for me  I guess maybe this draws on the success of it?!
           </p>
