               </div>
              </div>
              <!-- end comment-content-->
             </article>
             <!-- end comment-body -->
             <ul class="children">
              <li class="comment even depth-4" id="li-comment-147076">
               <article class="comment-body" id="comment-147076">
                <div class="avatar-box">
                 <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/c9b50a3cf30b4b725e5e136a979dba92?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/c9b50a3cf30b4b725e5e136a979dba92?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
                </div>
                <!-- end .avatar-box -->
                <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
                 <span class="fn">
                  <a class="url" href="http://www.willchatham.com" rel="external nofollow">
                   will
                  </a>
                 </span>
                 <span class="comment_date">
                  July 29, 2014
                 </span>
                </div>
                <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
                <div class="comment-content clearfix">
                 <p>
                  Id like to know this too. While you can say Yoast is compatible, and it will technically run just fine alongside Divi, much of the functionality built into Yoast simply does not work.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Yoast cannot read inside the Divi page structure because it falls outside the normal WordPress schema, therefor, you cannot use any of the Yoast page analysis tools. At all.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  This is often the problem with many third-party themes and Yoast or any decent SEO plugin.
                 </p>
                 <div class="reply-container">
                  <a aria-label="Reply to will" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=147076#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-147076", "147076", "respond", "6078" )'>
                   Reply
                  </a>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <!-- end comment-content-->
               </article>
               <!-- end comment-body -->
              </li>
              <!-- #comment-## -->
             </ul>

        <li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-156301">
         <article class="comment-body" id="comment-156301">
          <div class="avatar-box">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/116e5e9bffb1671f740bea4f50d8f64e?s=50&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/116e5e9bffb1671f740bea4f50d8f64e?s=100&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </div>
          <!-- end .avatar-box -->
          <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">
           <span class="fn">
            <a class="url" href="http://www.sleepopolis-mattress-reviews.com" rel="external nofollow">
             Derek
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="comment_date">
            January 20, 2015
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->
          <div class="comment-content clearfix">
           <p>
            Long-time ElegantTheme subscriber. Really late to the party on this Divi theme, but I finally decided to make the jump. So far, Im really impressed.
           </p>
           <p>
            There were a few questions I do have. Where is the sitemap page template? Shouldnt this be a module option? Same question for several of the old ET page templates that didnt make it to a Divi module.
           </p>
           <div class="reply-container">
            <a aria-label="Reply to Derek" class="comment-reply-link" href="/blog/theme-releases/divi-wordpress-theme?replytocom=156301#respond" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-156301", "156301", "respond", "6078" )'>
             Reply
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
          <!-- end comment-content-->
         </article>
         <!-- end comment-body -->
        </li>
        <!-- #comment-## -->
       </ol>
